sentence.Network_en: We were thunderstruck by the death of the President.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统之死使我们为之惊愕.

sentence.Network_en: I was thunderstruck when they told me the news.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他们告诉我这一消息时,我惊呆了.

sentence.Network_en: Hallward was thunderstruck. He looked at Dorian Gray in absolute amazement.
sentence.Network_cn: 哈尔伍德变得目瞪口呆. 他不知所措地瞧着道林·格雷.

entry.def: If you say that someone is thunderstruck, you mean that they are extremely surprised or shocked.

means.word_mean: 1. as if struck dumb with astonishment and surprise;

sentences.sentence: "a circle of policement stood dumbfounded by her denial of having seen the accident"
"was thunderstruck by the news of his promotion"

auth_sentence.content: He sat thunderstruck, speechless and uncomprehending.
